thread.title: N.B. plans snowmobile hub that will extend season, open new trails
thread.title_full: N.B. plans snowmobile hub that will extend season, open new trails - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: N.B. plans snowmobile hub that will extend season, open new trails
text:
SAINT-QUENTIN, N.B. - The New Brunswick government is planning to boost tourism at Mount Carleton Provincial Park when it counts the most — in winter.
New snowmobiling infrastructure — a centralized grooming hub — will be established at the northern park this summer and be ready for use by December.

A snowmobile travels a newly-groomed trail on Monday, Dec. 31, 2012 in East Montpelier, Vt. The New Brunswick government is planning to boost tourism at Mount Carleton Provincial Park when it counts the most ??? in winter. THE CANADIAN PRESS/AP/Toby Talbot 
The hub will extend the snowmobiling season in the region by several weeks, provide a fuelling station for snowmobilers and open up 343 kilometres of new trail areas, Tourism Minister Bill Fraser said.
"In northern New Brunswick, winter is the primary tourism season and snowmobiling is a key drawing card for visitors and tourism operators," he said in a statement.
Snowmobiling contributes $25 million annually to the provincial economy, Fraser said.
The province is contributing $710,000 to the project, the federal government $723,708, the town of Saint-Quentin $265,000 and the New Brunswick Federation of Snowmobile Clubs $75,000.
